formalText: She is having trouble with fear of germs and fear of intruders coming to attack her family.
She feels that if she doesn't do certain things each day that bad things will happen.
She feels that  she must do everything three times the washing, counting and checking, it takes up so much time and she knows it is not normal.
She wants to stop, she wants to feel normal again.
She is worried about keeping her family safe.
She is worried about being attacked.
She would like to get  help because she can't seem to get through the day without these rituals taking so much time out of her life.
They are getting worse.
She feels the need to wash her hands constantly.
She is afraid of getting germs from things that other people touch.
She feels need to wash her hands three times.
Every time she touches something that someone else may have touched such as door knob light switch for a faucet handle.
Then she is afraid that she will get get germs that could cause her to get sick.
She has fears that she will forget to lock the door or turn off the lights.
So I will go and turn the Lock 3 times in the need to wash my hands three times.
She find this happening so much that she is late for her job in the morning on her way to work.
She has had to turn around and drive home to see if she remembered to turn off the coffee pot.
She feels embarrassed because she knows what she is doing.
She feels that she can't stop it.
She is afraid that she will get some bad germs that will get into her body.
If she doesn't lock the door, then someone will come and attack her and her family if she doesn't check the doors in the windows and lock everything three times.
She just feel that something bad will happen.
Then, She is afraid that she forgot to lock the doors in the windows.
So she is repeatedly checking on them.
Then.
She must wash her hands three times because of germs.
She washes her hands probably 60 times a day.
She has separate laundry hampers for her clothes depending on where she wore them, work is different than the grocery store.
She checks everything before she leaves work, when she comes home from work and before bed and waking up in the morning, if she checked three times, then it feels right.
She wakes up anxious during the night and sometimes must check things in the house like the windows, doors, coffee pot and lights in the garage and closet.
Every time she comes into her office.
She also wipes the doorknob or avoids it.
She is 36 and she was about 12 or 13 when one of these things started for sure.
She started to really avoid anything that had contact with others hands, mainly always worried about being attacked or mugged by some criminal.
After her mother's funeral she felt the need to count and wash more often.
She wanted to die right after her mother passed.
She was depressed and felt so low, but she didn't attempt suicide.
She takes a multivitamin and Tylenol or Advil for headaches, which isn't often.
She drank a bit in college but never smoked.
She has three kids.
She has not experienced physical or sexual abuse at all.
Her mother died right after she was married about 11 years ago or maybe 10, it was right before she started her position with the accounting firm.
Her father passed just before she was married while she was still in college.
The Counting and washing increased after she started her job.
Her mother was a very neat and kept person.
Her mother was very particular about how she kept the house and her personal appearance.
She has contact dermatitis on her hands because they are irritated from the constant washing.
According to Dr. Green's records and MRI shows negative and blood work looks normal.
